meanings.definition: To move or draw towards the midline of the body.
meanings.sent1: She adducts her arms when doing jumping jacks.
meanings.sent2: The physical therapist showed the patient how to adduct the leg for the exercise.
meanings.sent3: The dance instructor joked that the robot adducts its arms in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The magnet adducts the metal paperclips with its strong pull.
meanings.sent5: The gravitational force adducts the planets towards the center of the solar system.

meanings.definition: A muscle that draws a body part towards the midline of the body.
meanings.sent1: The adducts in the inner thigh help with leg movements.
meanings.sent2: During the anatomy class, the teacher pointed out the adducts in the arm.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special power was having incredibly strong adducts in his legs.
meanings.sent4: The adducts in the hand work together to grip objects tightly.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's well-developed adducts allowed for precise control of movements.
